title: â€˜Bachelorâ€™ Season 20 Villain Olivia Caridi Feuds With Nick Viall on Twitter: â€˜Come at Me, Bro!â€™
text:
â€˜Bachelorâ€™ Season 20 Villain Olivia Caridi Feuds With Nick Viall on Twitter: â€˜Come at Me, Bro!â€™ February 14, 2017 @ 4:20 PM By Amanda Lucci 
Well, she has a point, bro! Bachelor Nation favorites Nick Viall and Olivia Caridi exchanged a playful war of words after Caridi noticed an awkward theme emerging during the Monday, February 13, episode of The Bachelor . (Read our full episode recap here!) PHOTOS: Biggest Reality TV Villains Ever! Nick Viall and Olivia Caridi Taylor Hill/Getty Images; John Lamparski/WireImage.com 
On Viallâ€™s first one-on-one date of the evening, special-education teacher Vanessa Grimaldi professed her love for him â€” making her the third woman to do so this season. Viall, 36, burst her bubble with his response: â€œI really, really like you, but it is incredibly important for me, if Iâ€™m lucky enough to feel love or say â€˜I love youâ€™ in this role, that I only say it to one person.â€ Oh. Vanessa Grimaldi and Nick Viall on 'The Bachelor' Rick Rowell/ABC via Getty Images PHOTOS: The Most Ridiculous â€˜Bachelorâ€™ and â€˜Bacheloretteâ€™ Job Titles Ever 
Caridi, 24, who appeared on Ben Higgins â€™ season 20 of The Bachelor , sarcastically called out Viall in an all-caps tweet for an issue that many viewers have been noticing in recent weeks: â€œNICK U HAVE HEARD THE WORD LOVE 3 TIMES FROM UR GIRLS N FREAKED OUT EVERY TIME WUT IS GOING ON I THOUGHT THIS WUZ ABOUT LUV.â€ NICK U HAVE HEARD THE WORD LOVE 3 TIMES FROM UR GIRLS N FREAKED OUT EVERY TIME WUT IS GOING ON I THOUGHT THIS WUZ ABOUT LUV #TheBachelor â€” Olivia Caridi (@OliviaCaridi) February 14, 2017 
Viall was quick to defend himself against the former villain, who was notoriously eliminated and left alone on an island during a two-on-one date with Emily Ferguson during Higginsâ€™ season. â€œOlivia is giving me notes ï¤”,â€ he pondered. Olivia is giving me notes ğŸ¤” https://t.co/zz5xlq09MA â€” Nick Viall (@viallnicholas28) February 14, 2017 
But Caridi got the last word in the most perfect way possible: with a GIF of herself saying â€œCome at me, broâ€ from her memorable turn on the show. You should know that you canâ€™t out-meme a former Bachelor villain, Viall! â€” Olivia Caridi (@OliviaCaridi) February 14, 2017 
Jokes aside, Caridi told Us in a Facebook Live video on Tuesday, February 14, that she does take issue with how Viall treated front-runner Grimaldi, 29. â€œSaying â€˜I love youâ€™ to someone is really freaky, let alone [with] cameras around. Sheâ€™s putting herself out there,â€ Caridi said. â€œIt just felt like he was almost lecturing her and scolding her and it confused her, and rightfully so. He screwed up there, and I just was not a fan of that. I just thought it was rude.â€
